intro: Microstylis laxa, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a small, herbaceous plant native to wetland environments in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant typically grows in shallow water or damp soil, forming dense clusters of grass-like leaves. Its flowering structures, called spikes, are relatively short and bear small, inconspicuous flowers. Microstylis laxa plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for aquatic invertebrates.
